content: Maybe if you post a screenshot of the Google popup it may help. My 'guess' is that this is the one-time popup that Google does to confirm that you want to use Thunderbird as your agent for Gmail. Click 'allow' and it never comes back. That is a security feature that Google administers.
creator: davidsk

content:
This is only for passwords, you can skip the monit and use Thunderbird without entering anything.

There should be a description in Settings similar to this: A Primary Password protects all your passwords.

Please read this article explaining what does it do: Protect your Thunderbird passwords with a Primary Password.

content: Er is een verschil tussen het labelen van berichten wat hier wordt uitgelegd: https://support.mozilla.org/nl/kb/berichtlabels (misschien oude schermafdrukken, maar principe is hetzelfde) en het organiseren/archiveren van berichten. U kunt een bericht een label 'Werk' geven, maar dan blijft het op dezelfde plaats staan. Voor het organiseren dient u het bericht te verplaatsen naar de map 2024. Dit kunt u doen middels knoppen boven het bericht, zie ook https://support.mozilla.org/nl/kb/van-start-met-het-hoofdvenster-van-thunderbird.
creator: Mozilla-assistent

content:
Questo comportamento si verifica quando una mail è stata inviata con il campo data vuoto o non valido. Il client (in questo caso Thunderbird) deve attribuire alla mail una data convenzionale che in questo caso è la data in cui il messaggio è stato scaricato. La stessa email sul server probabilmente avrà la data del giorno in cui è arrivata.

Purtroppo non è risolvibile nel senso che l'errore è a monte.
creator: @next

content:
Mi spiace ma è il server Microsoft che ti blocca l'accesso non è un errore di Thunderbird. Dovresti chiedere a Microsoft cosa non va.

Tieni conto comunque che la modalità di accesso predefinita per Outlook·com/Hotmail/Live non è la password per applicazione ma Ouath -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/autenticazione-oauth-microsoft-thunderbird-2023
creator: @next

content: The unified folders area only accounts for folders that exist in accounts and have the same name, such as Sent. The folders that appear below, under the account name, are folders whose names are unique to that account. If you invoke the "All Folders" option, you will see all folders together.
creator: davidsk

creator: davidsk

content: YES, but first do some homework. Do they both have desktop icons? Do they both access the same profile? Right-click on a desktop icon to see where each is stored. If in program files (x86), that would be a 32-bit version. Is one a beta? what are their release numbers (click help>about to see that). Some installs might accidentally uninstall both. If one is running the version you want, I would just go into Windows file explorer and delete the one not wanted. That sends it to the recycle bin. Start thunderbird and if all is working -- which I expect, you're done. If not, you may have deleted the wrong one. In recycle bin, just click to restore and start over.
creator: davidsk
